intro: Artanthe tiliifolia, commonly known as the mountain daisy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant features showy, yellow-orange flower heads with white ray florets, and it typically grows in rocky or open habitats. Artanthe tiliifolia is often found in alpine or subalpine regions, where it thrives in cooler, moist environments. Its botanical characteristics make it a distinctive and ecologically important species in its native range.
